“Allow me to explain,” Raskolnikov said. 

Ilya Petrovitch ignored him, rifling through papers. 

“I lived with her for nearly three years,” Raskolnikov continued. 

“I promised to marry her daughter. It was a youthful affair.” 

Ilya Petrovitch interrupted, “Nobody asks for these details. We have no time.” 

Raskolnikov pressed on, “A year ago, the girl died of typhus. 

I stayed. My landlady trusted me. 

She asked for an I O U for one hundred and fifteen roubles. 

‘If you give me that, I’ll trust you again,’ she said. 

Now, when I have nothing to eat, she demands payment.”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov explains his complicated relationship with his landlady and the circumstances leading to his current financial troubles.
